data.title: Nicky Henson obituary
data.meta_description: Nicky Henson used to joke that, despite half a century as a professional actor, his tombstone would read “Here lies Nicky Henson — he was in one episode of Fawlty Towers”. data.text:
Nicky Henson used to joke that, despite half a century as a professional actor, his tombstone would read “Here lies Nicky Henson — he was in one episode of Fawlty Towers”. People remember his turn as the vulgar womaniser who flirts with Sybil Fawlty and has a running battle with Basil Fawlty when the irascible hotelier suspects he has a woman in his room — he does and in the final scene it is revealed to be his aged mother. People remember it because it was just so funny.

John Cleese picked Henson for the role in the 1979 episode The Psychiatrist partly because they had been close friends for years, having shared a dressing room when they worked together on the satirical programme
